channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: In Berlin, there are movies, there's politics and there's talk about it all
item.description: Buzz around whether the city's film festival would take a stance on the war in Gaza has dominated conversation in recent days.
item.content:encoded:
Buzz around whether the city's film festival would take a stance on the war in Gaza has dominated conversation in recent days.

(Image credit: John MacDougall)
item.dc:creator: Teresa Xie

item.title: Alex Ferreira wins 10th gold medal for Team USA, matching America's highest total in Winter Olympics
item.description: Freeskier Alex Ferreira clinches a tenth gold medal for the U.S. in these Games, tying the U.S.'s all-time record for gold medals in a Winter Olympics.
item.content:encoded:
Freeskier Alex Ferreira clinches a tenth gold medal for the U.S. in these Games, tying the U.S.'s all-time record for gold medals in a Winter Olympics.

(Image credit: Patrick Smith)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Trump calls SCOTUS tariffs decision 'deeply disappointing' and lays out path forward
item.description: President Trump claimed the justices opposing his position were acting because of partisanship, though three of those ruling against his tariffs were appointed by Republican presidents.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump claimed the justices opposing his position were acting because of partisanship, though three of those ruling against his tariffs were appointed by Republican presidents.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: After dominant 6-2 win, the U.S. will face Canada for Olympic men's hockey gold
item.description: In the semifinal, Slovakia had few answers for the American onslaught. Now, the U.S. men will meet Canada for a chance to win the team's first Olympic hockey gold since the "Miracle on Ice" back in 1980.
item.content:encoded:
In the semifinal, Slovakia had few answers for the American onslaught. Now, the U.S. men will meet Canada for a chance to win the team's first Olympic hockey gold since the "Miracle on Ice" back in 1980.

(Image credit: JULIEN DE ROSA)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: NASA eyes March 6 to launch 4 astronauts to the moon on Artemis II mission
item.description: The four astronauts heading to the moon for the lunar fly-by are the first humans to venture there since 1972. The ten-day mission will travel more than 600,000 miles.
item.content:encoded:
The four astronauts heading to the moon for the lunar fly-by are the first humans to venture there since 1972. The ten-day mission will travel more than 600,000 miles.

(Image credit: Miguel J. Rodriguez Carrillo)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: On pins and needles: Why Olympians pass the time knitting
item.description: A number of Olympic athletes have turned to knitting during the heat of the Games, including Ben Ogden, who this week became the most decorated American male Olympic cross-country skier.
item.content:encoded:
Right: Bronze medallist USA's Jessie Diggins celebrates on the podium for the women's cross-country 10km. Both Olympians knit during their downtime between events.'/>

A number of Olympic athletes have turned to knitting during the heat of the Games, including Ben Ogden, who this week became the most decorated American male Olympic cross-country skier.

(Image credit: Anne-Christine Poujoulat)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: U.K. considers cutting ex-Prince Andrew from line of succession over his Epstein ties
item.description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, the British former prince, is being investigated on suspicion of misconduct in having shared confidential trade information with the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
item.content:encoded:
Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, the British former prince, is being investigated on suspicion of misconduct in having shared confidential trade information with the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

(Image credit: Kin Cheung)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Violinist Pekka Kuusisto is not afraid to ruffle a few feathers
item.description: On his new album, the violinist completely rethinks The Lark Ascending by Ralph Vaughan Williams, and leans into old folk songs with the help of Sam Amidon.
item.content:encoded:
On his new album, the violinist completely rethinks The Lark Ascending by Ralph Vaughan Williams, and leans into old folk songs with the help of Sam Amidon.

(Image credit: Bård Gunderson)
item.dc:creator: Tom Huizenga

item.title: 7 key things to know about Trump's tariffs after the Supreme Court decision
item.description: The Supreme Court ruled Friday that President Trump overstepped his authority in ordering tariffs on nearly everything the U.S. imports. Here's some economic context to understand that decision.
item.content:encoded:
The Supreme Court ruled Friday that President Trump overstepped his authority in ordering tariffs on nearly everything the U.S. imports. Here's some economic context to understand that decision.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Facing a mental health crisis, an NJ school pulled a beloved novel from English class
item.description: Junot Díaz's The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao was removed from an English class at the public school. PEN America says it's part of a trend of scrubbing literature dealing with uncomfortable topics.
item.content:encoded:
The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao from the curriculum of a high-level English class at Columbia High School in Maplewood, N.J., in response to a mental health crisis.'/>

Junot Díaz's The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao was removed from an English class at the public school. PEN America says it's part of a trend of scrubbing literature dealing with uncomfortable topics.

(Image credit: Anastasia Tsioulcas)
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas
